newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev ends weaker on expected main rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev ends weaker on expected main rate cut.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev fell to around 1,534-1,536 per dollar at close from the morning's 1,520-1,522, in anticipation of a cut in the central bank main interest rate, dealers said.
"The lev fell as banks and clients stepped up bidding for foreign currency in the afternoon, expecting the central bank to pare the main interest rate today," a bank dealer said.
The main rate has been set at 5.2 percent monthly since Monday.
Central bank officials were unavailable for comment.
Traders said the central bank was likely to cut the main rate in line with the falling yield of short-term government securities auctioned this week.
The central bank adjusts the rate weekly to the average weighted effective monthly yields on one-week and four-week discount T-bills, sold by the Finance Ministry during the week.
Yields to maturity on one- and four-week T-bills have persistently declined from 0.82 and 4.68 respectively on Friday to 0.58 and 3.84 percent today, central bank figures showed.
